image.altText: A white man, dark brown hair wearing a navy suit, orange tie sitting in a leather chair in front of teal wall.

props.synopsis: The Country Liberal Party committed to a 43 per cent reduction in emissions by 2030 leading into last year's NT election, which it won from opposition. The environment minister now says that target will not be implemented.

title.children: NT government says it will not implement 2030 emissions reduction target

image.altText: A rainbow flag waving outside of Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The NT government has walked back on its plans to scrap hate speech protections in the territory's anti-discrimination laws. However there are still fears the changes will "water down" laws against vilification.

title.children: NT government accused of 'watering down' anti-discrimination laws

image.altText: Man in trucker hat walking outside of court.

props.synopsis: The NT Supreme Court trial of celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright has been delayed for three weeks. It comes as his defence team seeks thousands of pages of mobile phone records from a witness.

title.children: Netflix star Matt Wright's trial delayed, amid clash over witness phone records

image.altText: A politician with blonde hair, wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: The NT attorney-general has revealed a $300,000 racism review into the NT Police Force has been scrapped, with the funding redirected to Legal Aid.

title.children: NT police racism review scrapped, funding redirected

image.altText: A person hauls nets and marine debris buried underneath the white sand at a beach in Arnhem Land

props.synopsis: It's rubbish season in northern Australia, when tonnes of plastic and discarded fishing nets wash ashore in the Gulf of Carpentaria. But the future of funding for clean-up patrols is unclear.

title.children: Gulf ghost-net patrols fear tide turning in fight to save remote beaches

image.altText: A Timor-Leste player kicking a soccer ball onto the field.

props.synopsis: Timor-Leste representatives say the national soccer team's victory in an Asian Cup qualifier in Darwin isn't just about boosting its chances in the competition, but is also a powerful showcase of culture and community.

title.children: Soccer strengthening cultural ties as Top End hosts Timor-Leste

image.altText: Origin5QH

props.synopsis: Queensland survived a ferocious comeback from NSW to level the State of Origin series and force a decider in Sydney. Here are the five quick hits from State of Origin II.

title.children: Five quick hits — Hammer shines in Qld win as Blues goal kicking woes continue

image.altText: Hands take Australian money notes out of a wallet.

props.synopsis: At the largest ASX-listed companies, chief executives continue to earn 55 times the average earnings of an Australian worker, but termination payouts for the business elite have dropped to their lowest level in 15 years.

title.children: Salaries of Australia's highest-paid CEOs revealed

image.altText: A graphic of a plane flying in front of an American flag

props.synopsis: The recent case of an Australian writer detained and denied entry to the US after being questioned about his political views has spotlighted the risks facing Australians under the US visa waiver program.

title.children: Legal experts sound warning: Don't assume you'll be let into the US easily

image.altText: A satellite GIF of clouds moving over the Australian continent between March 13 and March 31

props.synopsis: The areas over the ocean where storm clouds form have dwindled by up to 3 per cent in the past two decades, new research led by NASA shows.

title.children: Earth's shrinking cloud cover may hold the key to climate mystery

image.altText: grey station wagon and motobike stopped on the road to see orange and white plumes of smoke from the volcano

props.synopsis: The backlog of flights delayed or cancelled because of the eruption is expected to take some time to clear despite some airlines resuming services.

title.children: Bali holiday-makers face days-long flight delays after volcanic eruption

image.altText: A headshot of a man with slicked back hair is next to a headshot of a woman with long black hair

props.synopsis: The second-largest party in Thailand's ruling coalition has spectacularly pulled out, leaving the country's embattled prime minister with a slim majority.

title.children: How a leaked phone call sparked a political crisis in Thailand

image.altText: A video stream on a laptop, showing a women with green lines and dots all over her face

props.synopsis: Children as young as 15 were repeatedly misidentified as being in their 20s and 30s during government tests of age-checking tools, sowing new doubts about whether the teen social media ban is viable.

title.children: With six months until teen social media ban, experts don't think tech is viable

image.altText: Heart reef - only 17 metres in diameter - seen from the air in a scenic flight.

props.synopsis: After the two previous terms of government failed to reform environmental approval laws, Environment Minister Murray Watt brings together stakeholders to see if an agreement can be struck to finally update the EPBC Act.

title.children: Environment 'compromise' needed, says Watt, as he seeks debate reset

image.altText: Vision shows damage to the Northland shopping centre and emergency services gathered outside.

props.synopsis: Shocked witnesses say they heard screams before seeing a stolen car driving past them at speed inside a shopping centre in Melbourne's north on Wednesday,

title.children: Vision shows 'terrifying' moment stolen car drove through shopping centre

image.altText: Five ciagrettes standing on their filters.

props.synopsis: Queensland's health minister has called on the federal government to tighten laws after revelations about how largely unregulated private ATMs are helping fuel illegal tobacco sales.

title.children: Calls to clamp down as private ATMs become 'target for criminals'

image.altText: Black sign on a beige wall

props.synopsis: The NSW government will soon allow private developers to build infrastructure as well as offer a 50 per cent land tax discount on build-to-rent properties.

title.children: NSW government's plan to fast-track rental supply in high-growth areas

image.altText: Tomatoes on display at a store.

props.synopsis: A virus outbreak in southern states and wet weather in northern growing areas cause a tomato shortage and an increase in prices when they are available.

title.children: What's behind the tomato shortage?

image.altText: a female truck driver wearing a maroon vest in front of her truck

props.synopsis: The state's transport minister admits more needs to be done to maintain existing assets, rather than just building new infrastructure.

title.children: State government vows to do a 'better job' as roads maintenance bill grows

image.altText: Woman wearing a grey hoodie in a park

props.synopsis: Shakira Robertson has waited two years to hear the word "guilty" come out of the mouth of the man charged over her mother's death. She heard it this week.

title.children: Grieving daughter finally hears the word 'guilty' after losing mother

image.altText: Liam O'Hanna

props.synopsis: Liam Óg Ó hAnnaidh, whose stage name is Mo Chara, is alleged to have waved the flag of the banned militant group Hezbollah during a Kneecap gig in London in November 2024.

title.children: Kneecap rapper charged with terror offence free to play Glastonbury

image.altText: A cosy night at the Crescent Hotel trivia, 03 June 2025 2025-06-03 10:06:00

props.synopsis: The days are shorter in Hobart in winter, and the city has the highest prevalence of seasonal depression in the country. So how do locals find light in dark times?

title.children: Socialising, exercise vital to keeping SAD at bay in Australia's colder cities

image.altText: A furry vest, gloves and ugg boots.

props.synopsis: Clothing containing cat fur is still being sold in Victoria while being labelled as fake or sheep's wool, an advocacy group says, years after a state government taskforce vowed to crack down on the practice.

title.children: Calls for statewide ban after cat fur vest found in Victorian stores

image.altText: A black dog jumping up looking happy

props.synopsis: Since the beginning of the COVID pandemic telemedicine has exploded — not just for humans, but for pets too.

title.children: Pet owners turn to veterinary telemedicine for non-emergencies

image.altText: Two people now charged over alleged kidnap and torture of teenager

props.synopsis: A Cairns magistrate hears the man threatened an allegedly tortured 19-year-old woman with a replica gun and made her write a "demeaning" apology to a co-accused. Three people have been charged with multiple offences.

title.children: Kidnapping accused forced bloodied teen to write apology, court hears

image.altText: Man in a scubasuit stands in a metal cage in the ocean, two men in a small boat look over edge and chat to him

props.synopsis: In Port Lincoln, where some of the underwater shark scenes were filmed, it brought huge economic benefits, but also did untold damage to attitudes towards sharks that still linger today.

title.children: Australians behind Jaws reflect on the movie's legacy 50 years on

image.altText: a balding man in police uniform

props.synopsis: More details have been revealed about the shooting which claimed the life of Tasmania Police Constable Keith Smith, including that Special Operations Group personnel at the property to assist were not in their gear when the shooting happened.

title.children: SOG officers not in tactical gear when police officer fatally shot

image.altText: A man's forearm focused at the interior of the elbow with a needle injected withdrawing blood.

props.synopsis: Restrictions around sexually active gay and bisexual men donating blood and plasma are being loosened in a new world-leading move by Australian Red Cross Lifeblood.

title.children: World-leading changes to sexual activity rules for blood, plasma donating

image.altText: A sign that is blue, white and grey that reads MSI United Kingdom Reproductive Choices Central London.

props.synopsis: The vote to decriminalise abortion was made to stop a growing number of women from being investigated by police for terminating their pregnancies.

title.children: UK parliament votes to decriminalise abortion, repealing 19th-century law

image.altText: a loader with a bucket full of wheat

props.synopsis: Competition grows in Western Australia wheat exports as farmers fed up with export costs send an independent grain shipment from Geraldton to Indonesia.

title.children: Historic wheat shipment ends CBH's 85-year export monopoly at WA port

image.altText: Eddie Perfect, a 47-year-old man in a suit, sits smiling in a green chair, hands clasped in his lap.

props.synopsis: Beetlejuice the Musical wasn't expected to make it through 2019, following low ticket sales and negative reviews. The show came back from the dead, and is now in Melbourne.

title.children: The Beetlejuice musical was 'going to die'. This is how it was saved

image.altText: a crude oil tanker sails away from the camera in foggy murky waters

props.synopsis: The government says "Russia uses these vessels to circumvent international sanctions and sustain its illegal and immoral war against Ukraine".

title.children: Australia hits Russia's 'deceptive' shadow fleet with sanctions

image.altText: Brad Lander being placed under arrest with multiple ICE enforcement trying to grab him

props.synopsis: Brad Lander's arrest for the alleged assault of a federal officer is the latest confrontation between US ICE agents and Democratic politicians.

title.children: ICE arrests New York mayoral candidate for alleged assault

image.altText: Spurs manager Ange Postecoglou looks past a smiling chairman Daniel Levy as they shake hands after a big win.

props.synopsis: Spurs chairman Daniel Levy speaks for the first time about the sacking of Ange Postecoglou, saying he does not regret appointing the Australian but defends the dismissal as a difficult but correct call.

title.children: 'We've made the right decision': Spurs' Levy defends Postecoglou sacking

image.altText: GettyImages-2217989547

props.synopsis: Officials reveal a 15 per cent increase in prize money, taking the purse for this week's Women's PGA Championship in Texas to $18.5 million.

title.children: Aussie golfers eye equal-biggest purse in LPGA history
